Pore/Structural Features.Pore Size: 3.4 Å (ZIF-8 aperture), 11.6 Å (ZIF-8 cavities), 3.0 Å (ZIF-11 aperture), 14.6 Å (ZIF-11 cavities)
Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Core-shell structure with ZIF-11 core and ZIF-8 shell

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Preferential adsorption due to higher polarity and quadrupole moment

Other Information.Additional Info: Adsorption capacity increased from 4.35 mmol/g in ZIF-11 to 8.21 mmol/g in ZIF-11@ZIF-8

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Size exclusion due to smaller pore windows than molecular size

Other Information.Additional Info: Lowest uptake among tested gases due to nonpolar nature

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Kinetic sieving with some flexibility effect

Other Information.Additional Info: Slight increase in adsorption from 1.41 mmol/g in ZIF-11 to 1.59 mmol/g in ZIF-11@ZIF-8 at 298 K
Adsorption capacity increased from 10.06 mmol/g in ZIF-11 to 11.81 mmol/g in ZIF-11@ZIF-8

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Preferential adsorption due to larger size and higher polarizability

Other Information.Additional Info: Significant increase in adsorption from 10.83 mmol/g in ZIF-11 to 17.83 mmol/g in ZIF-11@ZIF-8

Sieving Mechanism: Combination of size exclusion by ZIF-8 shell and enhanced adsorption by flexible ZIF-11 core

Experimental Validation.Method: Gas adsorption measurements using pressure-decay method

Other Information.Additional Info: The core-shell structure shows synergistic effect of high adsorption capacity and selectivity
